result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Frierson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation with the Mental Health Unit for 12 months with the following conditions:

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation or civil judgment.

Stay on all prescribed medications.
Cognitive Intervention Program.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No illegal drugs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Frierson Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas Frierson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  

Defendant ordered to serve 8 months in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation with the Mental Health Unit for 12 months with the following conditions:

*Stay on all prescribed medications. 
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
*Cognitive Intervention program. 
*Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation or civil judgment.  

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Thomas Frierson not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that defendant is in custody.  Court vacates bench warrant.    Court orders case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for sentencing hearing.  Defendant failing to appear.  Defense requests a stayed bench warrant.  On the state's motion, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  NO BAIL FORFEITED.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Thomas Frierson not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for sentencing hearing.  Defendant not produced due to pending charges.  Court orders case adjourned to branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas Frierson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Sentencing Hearing. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas Frierson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Morgan Willz supervised by Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Case adjourned to branch 23 for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas Frierson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz, appears under the student practice rule, under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Catelin Ringersma for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests additional time to review discovery with defendant.  No objection from the state. Court grants request.  Case adjourned for plea/sentencing.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Thomas Frierson not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests and adjourned plea/sentencing date. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Thomas Frierson not in court, in custody, not produced.   Kathryn M West appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-07-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY WAL-MART STORE IN MILWAUKEE COUNTY.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Thomas Frierson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Thomas Frierson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
